intro: Robinsonella discolor, commonly known as the red-flowered rock cress, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, cross-shaped flowers. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of fleshy, dark green leaves and clusters of bright red, four-petaled flowers. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Due to its striking color and unique appearance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens for ornamental purposes.
